one_reviews_text: This game is great but it really needs to come to the quest 2.
Why not available  for the qeust two bruh it's good tho

I just like it in gerneral. Just you, on a lake. The only thing is they don't update that much. I would also like to see a bit better graphics. Now my dream is that they add like new boats, and new lakes you unlock after catching a fish or sumething. Other than that, it's a great game! Definetly would recomend if you like fishing.
funnest game ive ever played very fun (kinda boring when your realing a really big fish for 5 minutes) but other than what perfect!

review_title: good but needs a recenter option
one_reviews_text: This game is a blast and so calming  but there is one problem that really messes with this game. Whenever I start the game i always have to go up to my desk to grab the fishing rod or steer the boat with bangs up the controllers. It would be a lot  easier if there was a option in settings  to recenter and put you in the middile of the boat. Sometimes when i start the front of the boat is facing my bed  which makes fishing impossible. If there is a recenter option that I donot know about please tell me.

review_title: I do wish there was more than one lake
one_reviews_text:
I love this game quite a lot; it's perfect for relaxing in VR. Most of the other games I enjoy involve quite a bit more effort to play.  
If you have a swivel chair, it'll work fantastically.  
If you want more of an arcade-style game, do not try to find it here. It may not be super realistic, but it is a sim through and through.  
I just love the "do whatever you want" feel. I love the feel of the fish popping out of the water. I love feel of casting the line. Reeling the line in. I don't so much love the rowing, but it passes barely and isn't the focus.  
I love the updates, the caves were super-cool even though if it highlighted the struggles with rowing sometimes.  
If you want something stimulating, this honestly isn't for you. This is for you to get away from all the stimulation and just chill on a boat on a lake.  
(Wish there were more lakes to get lost on though.)

lower the chance to get a gosh dang redtail
jeez
 
apart from that this is a great game and highly recomend it

Do you like sitting uselessly in a boat during a rain and thunder storm?  Do you hate sunshine and tranquil time spent in nature?  Do you like spending your fishing time rowing back and forth from one end of a rain-soaked lake to the other?  If so, you'll love Catch and Release.  Clearly the developers looked for the most miserable parts of fishing they could think up and put them in one game.  It is something of a shame.  The game mechanics are pretty good and there are some surprisingly fun aspects to it.  I just got so sick of the rain and the rowing I didn't want to "play" any more.
Had a nice 2 weeks with it, got bored shortly after. Will come back if there is new content.

I was very excited to try this game and with the first cast attempt became very frustrated. The fishing wire seems to be constructed of a rubber band, and just flings back and smacks me in the face. I love the rowing mechanics, and the scenery is cool, but this could have been an epic game. If anyone owned a Dreamcast, I'm sure they remember Sega's bass fishing (1997). Do you want a fishing game or a fishing sim? As a fishing sim the 9 other people I know who have bought/played it have given up and 3 of them have not picked up their quest/rift since. (90% product fail ratio, 30% platform fail ratio) I've read other reviews, and the developer is doing a good thing and bringing the non-casual user base to this new and emerging technology. As a fellow developer I understand the significace of appealing to this market. I'll give it another go around, hopefully will update my rating. 

Recommendations
*Implement a mode where you can get a more granular interaction with the fish. (See Sega Bass Fishing). As we gamers age, nostalgia is a big thing. 
*Fix the casting issue
*Spoon feed the player a little bit more
*Weather and time of day randomizations would be cool.

one of the best vr fishing games i seen , the lake is short but quite beautyfull and full of diferent fishes.
you need diferent things and techniques too catch diferent fish what makes it more chalenging and there are some missions you can follow until you catch the king of the lake.(but is broken)

Edit: all is true but the game is broken a little ahead in the game and i get more than 5 minutes waiting for something to bite at times...
The mission tell me to catch a lake dull i get to the place do everything the game tells and nothing just fishes that should not be there.
The game is relaxing but as a game is broken in parts and there is better than this

41 years of age fished IRL since i was a boy and played every fishing game/sim theres ever been, this my friends beats them all. Don't think that i need to write to much more. It's as real as it gets and so much fun to boot.. very hard to get that in a fishing game these days.
Simple, honest gaming, well worth owning a copy.

DEVS CAN YOU GIVE ME ANY WORD ON IF THIS WILL COME TO OCULUS QUEST???  I love this game, but this is a game I'd much rather play on my living room couch, at dining table, in bed, on the go while on vacation etc instead of my small computer room.  Awesome game though, highly recommend!!!!!

It's got everything you expect from a fishing game with polished graphics and beautiful scenery. The new night mode is exactly what I needed too. Spending the night fishing away and marking off challenges with a podcast or custom music going on in the background. The devs really are putting their hearts into this game with the updates that roll in. I always come back to this game when I want to chill out and it never fails to satisfy. Also would love to see this game on the Quest hopefully one day.

I have always enjoyed fishing from a young age but due to ill health i was not able to do it anymore, until i found this. This game is a little gem and really gives you the enjoyment of fishing and fully immersis you into a world where you can relax and forget your troubles even if only for a while. And with how easy it is to play and use with the Rift i can still enjoy this great pasttime. The fact that you can do things at your own pace yet there are still goals to work for your not frantically trying to achieve these which for me and my disabilities makes those types of games impossible for me to play for long or even if at all. Thanks to the Devs for such a great game and i look forward to seeing what else you may have for "release" in the future and here's to many future hours of fishing. P.S this game to me is a must have title and with the price point and what you actually get for your money its a no-brainer.

What happened?  This sucks.  I had a lot of time invested in this.

Wht did you do devs?  I hadn't played in a few weeks and came back to a completely unplayable sim.  I can't load my progress, I can't get positioned in the boat correctly.  Fix this crap or give me my money back.
This game is very relaxing and fun to play, the songs on the radio are amazing and so is the game in general. The mechanics are great and I recommend this game to whoever is reading this.

I've played about 2 h and i'm looking forward to the next session. 
And i appreciate the localization (i.g. german).

save your dollars there is a way better fishing app in the rift store and it is 100 times closer to real life fishing and you can move around without the boat if you like. I got the game based on all the positive reviews, every one of those are an out right lie.

review_title: Looks great, but PLEASE fix casting!
one_reviews_text:
When I cast in real life, I hold down the reel's trigger, swing, and let go at the end of the swing... In this game, I can't figure out how it's supposed to work, when I hold down the trigger, the hook&bobber just fall immediately, which is NOT how a reel is supposed to work. The trigger is supposed to act like a brake on the line, and letting go at the end of the swing casts it out.
I REALLY hope they can change this, or add an option for it, cause otherwise I can't play this.. I fish too much in real life, and I can't change my casting habbit, and it's really frustraiting trying to play this right now. :(
Also, please make a Quest version! ;)
I love this game so much and would love to see it on the Oculus quest. I'm going to be buying one soon and this game would be great to show to my grandpa

review_title: Just the sort of thing VR is meant for!
one_reviews_text: I've never gone fishing in real life, so I figured, let's give it a try in VR! I'm really glad I did! After about twenty minutes out on the lake, a massive thunderstorm rolled in! Hail, thunder and lightning! In real life, it would have been dangerous and scary, but from the safety of VR, it felt amazing! Kudos to the developer for a fantastic game!

great game some as realistic as it can be but one tiny problem irl fish of pray like bass salmon pike dont run away from vibration like a bobber hitting the water i would really like it if they added something in the game that made fish a prey more predetory and go towads vibration
I think this should come on the quest as it isnt harsh graphics so it should run just fine

review_title: Currently the best VR fishing game
one_reviews_text:
Catch & Release isn't the most inovative game out there. It's pretty simple. You get your bait on the hook, reel your line in, cast out, and catch fish. That's it.

What it does do, it does well. You sit on a lake and catch fish. It's pretty chill. I use it as a de-stressing game a lot.

Just started playing but this is a fun little game, really relaxing after work type game.  I wish there was some better kind of indication when you're going to snap the line though it seems like a bit of a guessing game right now.   And it would be cool if you could get a motor for your boat out of the gear store but I don't think that's an option.  But otherwise it's a good fishing simulator, you do similar actions in game that you would do IRL adding to the realism.    I saw a moose go running by in the forest as well, adds to the entertainment value watching the scenery for things.

Also works great on Rift S, no tracking issues here.
Cool game! With online multiplayer and competitions this would be the best game ever.
This is the fishing game I always wanted can't believe it took this long to finally get a good vr fishing game.

I really, really love this title. Fished often with my Dad when youngster and brings back great memories. Fish behaviors mostly realistic and fun.

Great game to engage in after a long day just to relax and even get in some exercise rowing around :-P

I so wanted to finish the game but for a long stint there was a bug that prevented the 'boss fish' from returning. Then once that problem was patched, Slackjaw boss was like uber and no matter what strategy I tried, he snapped the line. 

After 100 attempts or so gave up, and never got to whatever content might be available after.

Devs: Incorporate something so that fish don't come back at full strength when snagged again immediately after fighting them for several minutes.

Four stars, because the rod and line are not simulated very well: if you shake the rod left to right, you wont see the tip flex around, and little waves form in the line. The rod flexes only as a scripted event.

But +1 star for the deer that randomly appeared in the forest next to the water lilies :)

Very relaxing game.
Altough the fishing mechanic itself could be better.
Like in Pro fishing it feels more realistic (except for small fish feel like 50 pounders) but the fight just feels more real in Pro fishing.
There is pretty much zero warning here when you will snap the line.
But overall very satisfied and worth the money.

review_title: Very relaxing game, worth the money
one_reviews_text: This game is great overall, the scenery is beutiful and the sounds are amazing. There are some occasional bugs, like fish swiming through the ground, or the bobber flying around like crazy, but it's acceptible for what kind of game it is. I wish this game had some sort of fly fishing mechanic, other than that, Great game.

review_title: Relaxing fun with nice background detail
one_reviews_text:
It's a simple, slow-paced game, but that's its strength. Row your boat on a lake with cartoon-style woodland scenery while casting your line. As you catch fish, you earn play money and level up to get better gear so you can go after the big ones.

The background details are light fun: sandwiches and sodas, wildlife (bears, moose and more) wandering past. Insects buzzing past your ear. 

There are some flaws that I hope the developer fixes. 

* It's sometimes hard to manipulate items in the boat, like opening/closing the cooler and lunchbox. You can't transfer things from one hand to the other. 

* There's some oddities with collision boxes. The fishing line, rod, and other objects pass through the boat. This detracts from the immersion a lot.

* If you rotate your view while the line is in the water, it yanks the line around to the new location suddenly, which startles the fish and can send your float flying overhead.

I'd like to see the ability to change the time of day, and the effect that has on fish as some of them take shade under reeds etc. But it's an inexpensive game, so I wouldn't expect extra fancy stuff like that.

I enjoy it still after a few long sessions, and I'll definitely keep playing when I need some indoor downtime.

Love this game, very relaxing. I really appreciate all the objects you can interact with in your near area- feels very immersive. Music on the radio is all great and you can even add your own!

I really hope that they decide to add multiplayer, more times of day, maybe expand the lake a bit with a river section and new fish. I also find the fishing mechanics are a bit unclear, I had to look up what I was supposed to be doing. They should include a couple of pages in the fishing book with some fishing controls and instructions.

So I don't think this game is perfect, but it is the best fishing simulator in VR we have so far. There's not even a close second. So this is the game to get if you are interested in that subgenre. Just remember, this is supposed to be a relaxing game. Do you like fishing in real life? Want a similar feel in VR? Then this is a must buy!

review_title: Great game if you know the mechanics
one_reviews_text: I have really enjoyed this for fishing and relaxing.  I have not played it through yet but I hope it will continue to develop and offer new environments, fish, and challenges.  Just remember that the trigger button is used to release the line AND provide the drag, which helps with maintaining the tension on the rod.  It is more like those trigger rods that you find at walmart, which is definitely easier to handle than the traditional reel.

First off, I love this game!!! Its a great fishing experience and I'd reccomend this to anyone for the $20 it cost. The Dev's are awesome and respond to reviews. They were able to fix a save issue in less than a week and now this is my must play VR title!!! Loving the radio by the way!!!

A few ideas (For Dev's)
- Customizeable Characters, Boats, and Rods
- Ability to toss food into your mouth
- Maybe Multiplayer???
- Option for lbs as well as the metric enabled
- More wildlife inlucing birds (eagles...) (I truly love the addition of the bear)
- A long range grab option (hard to get bait that's fallen at times)
- New areas 
- Keep doing what you're doing, game rocks!!!
Great!!!!

review_title: Fun by has alot of bugs
one_reviews_text: I played this game for about 8 hours total. I was going through the campaign which is kinda boring to be honest. I did have fun a times and who doesnt like fishing. Things I disklike was the bugs, picking up the scale for example was a nightmare along with changing your poles while a lure is still on the lure will not be removeable and will make you restart your game all the way to the beginning. The biggest bug I came across on my game was I got all the way to the last boss fish, I did the update and no matter where I through the lure no fish you come, the day prior before this new update I had him on the line two times and lost him. I am very disappointed in this game for the lack of smooth running mechanices and memory for your saved game. I even attempted to paddle across the entire lake 8 times throwing out the golden lure. NOTHING. I then force shut down theg game. puts me right back where I started with nothing. TOTAL BUST! dont buy.
review_feedback:
Hey there, 

UPDATE:
Hey kickinitOG7
We issued an update today that solved most (if not all) of the issues you mentioned. 
Please let us know if you encounter any other bugs.

Kind regards,

Previous comment:
Sorry to read that you have had so many issues. However, I would still like to thank you for your support and having the patience to play the game! With regards to your biggest issue/bu, we issued a patch for the game that should resolve the save game issues. 
Please let us know if it still occurs, our team is standby to investigate the matter further should this be the case! Thanks!

one_reviews_text: If you are looking to waste your money this is the game for you! Can't get the notebook page to turn. Catch a fish and your reeling stops halfway to boat and you lose the fish. Really feeling like the suckerfish for buying this game.

As someone who does fish in real life, I found some of the controls a little clunky and its really easy to lose a fish in the game compared to real life. 

Something needs to be put in the game that calculates 
A: how well you set the hook
B: the strenth of the line you are using
C: the strenth/weight of the fish
A small fish that has a hook well set should have minimum chance of coming off

Casting felt odd to hold a button to cast and this broke the immersion for me. In real lift, you throw the bail arm over and put your finger on the spool. When you cast, you remove your finger through the cast to release the line. To press a trigger in to have the same effect felt ailen. Maybe you could have it that you press the button in then bress A or B to release the bail arm. Then let go of the trigger to lock the bail arm back over?

Last issue, no left handed option. I fish left handed so everything felt a bit off from the start.

Great start to the game though and hope it continues to be developped
review_feedback:
Thanks for your review and feedback. We're always listening to feedback and use it to shape development as we move forward. As for your request for a left-handed option, that already exists. Simply pick up the rod with your left hand, and the rod will switch over to left-handed mode.

We hope you continue to enjoy Catch & Release and are looking forward to bringing more content to players in the future.

review_title: A GG with a lot of scope.
one_reviews_text:
At last a decent Fishing game in VR , this is definitely one of the better if not the best Virtual Reality Angling games I have tried so far , the game I feel is aiming for a more realistic approach with no gimmicks, bells or whistles, just you the rowing boat and a few essential accessories/tackle and a very pleasant location to while away a few hours, bites come thick and fast with a variety of species on offer, So far the main method of fishing is by float and baits such as maggot/grub and some cheese. Graphics are well above average and performance on my system was very decent with no issues at all, the game mechanics and physics could do with a few tweaks here and there, the haptic feedback is spot on, overall a very respectable 4-5 Stars. 
I haven't unlocked too much of the game as yet but I can see the game has quite a lot of scope if the developers continue adding missions , tackle and possibly a few more venues/ locations. I hope the developers continue to build on what they have already created so far and I wish them the best of luck for the future. GG

I am playing maxed settings and the game looks and runs great.  It feels like the controls could be a little tighter when you are gripping stuff and reeling the rod, but maybe this is just on my end.  I don't fish in real life, but for some reason I fish every chance I get in games so I thought I'd give this a shot.  There is definitely a calming ambiance to the experience.  You can row around the lake, and when you are fishing you can look into the water and see the fish, and the water effects are nice enough it actually looks like you are looking down into the water.  I'm really glad I got this game, but I do hope they add stuff like more fish, different lakes, different times of day, etc.  If those things were free that would be great, but I'd even be willing to pay for dlc if they had to go that route.  *Edit: I updated to 5/5 stars.  I am feeling more comfortable with controls and really having fun with the game.  I've definitely gotten my moneys worth :)

review_title: By Far the best Fishing game.
one_reviews_text: While it is the best fishing game I have ever seen, I find that it is a bit easier to lose the fish than it is in real life. Also it could just be my tracking but reeling the line in seems to give me problems from time to time as I need to use my whole arm to do it.

review_title: VR fishing that has me hooked.
one_reviews_text:
Update: After spending more time with the game, I've changed my mind and will give this game 5 stars. Before I say anything, I have only went fishing in real life for about 40 hours total.

That being said, this game has the best fishing mechanics that I've tried for the VR. The fishing feels real and isn't just something that you can rush but that adds to the experience.  A fast pace fishing game would feel awkward. 

The visuals for the game is nice. It has a cartoonish feel that is very nice to look at and isn't too painful for the eyes if you're going to play the game for hours straight . (Btw if the sun is bothering you then use the hat in game. Hats off to the developers for this idea)

Sound effects wise, I feel like this game has it down. You could just sit down and close your eyes to enjoy the sounds of the lake environment around you. I like to cast my line out and then sit down while I wait for a bite. I play the game with a chair nearby so my feet don't get tired. Plus, standing up in a boat for an hour wouldn't be comfortable in real life. Also imagine rowing standing up. 

I'd recommend this game to someone thats want to relax and unwind after a long hectic day. Just grab a chair and take in the experience that the game has to offer. Don't expect the fish to throw themselves on your hook or your boat. It just adds to the reelism... Get it? 

Did I mention that this game has beer in it?

I am by no means a fisherman and I think that lets me overlook some of the issues where VR doesn't match up with reality in this game.  Apparently the way the rod is cast is not realistic, but I would have never known without reading a review.  It's a lot of fun for me to just sit and listen to the wildlife while fishing.  I did have to learn to tire the fish out instead of just relentlessly reeling in the line -- that usually ends with a broken line.  Now I have a pretty high success rate with the starter fish.  

I tried the Steam version first, but refunded it because of tracking issues, but it all seems to work a lot better with the Oculus store version.  I am hoping they add more lakes and fish in the future.  I am not sure how many missions are in your journal, but having a goal makes the game a lot more fun so I hope they add lots of those as well.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ieTclOvi35I

Having spent most of my teenage years fishing this experience brought back a lot of fond memories.
The physics and handling felt spot on and I only had a few issues with the fish seemingly popping out the water like on a rocket, but I'm sure this is just a weird bug that can be fixed.
All in all this game gave me a really good sense of fishing on a lake, it's perfect for VR and I can't wait to spend more time exploring this unique experience.

I have sunk in 20 hours to this game now, bought nearly everything from the shop and have the best rod (carbon). This game is so fun and chilled out. The physics of fighting the fish is actually really immersive, rod twitches etc its great. Maybe I love it so much because I fish IRL but still. 5 stars for me!.

PS - I hope there is some new content coming, maybe new lakes? etc.

Probably the best vr fishing game to date but that doesn't say much.  I question if these devs have ever fished with a spinning rod before?  Because that's not how it works.  You hold the rod in between you index and ring finger where the reel meets the rod.  On top of that you should pull and hold the trigger button down then cast and let go at the right time to simulate a spinning reel cast.  That type of mechanic could be a type of minigame in itself but not here.  Instead you pull the trigger at the right time while you are casting.  If you have never fished I guess its not a big deal but was very disappointing and absolutely killed it for me.  Graphics are not too bad and the atmosphere seems nice and relaxing though.  If you have never fished then I am sure it is fine, but if you have used a spinning reel then get ready for frustration.

It is an overall Best game, i fish all the time in the real world and this is the best alternative for when its rainy and windy. The only problems i had with it was that the fish dissapear the moment you grab them off the hook, sometimes the game put it on the boat for you but it often releases it to the lake.

I enjoy playing this after work. Getting out in the middle of the lake on a boat fishing is relaxing. Graphics are decent as well. Only gripe is sometimes reeling in can be a chore trying to make sure my hand movement matches the hand with the line reeler in VR.
Relaxing expirence. I just wish the pole was scaled better.

While listening to the radio, I go fishing leisurely. It can be very relaxing.
There is some dissatisfaction in a small place(small lake, radio is interrupted, the system to fishing isnt good. I dont feel fish up...), Anyway I look forward to future update.
Does what it says.
This game is chill AF. If you like fishing just drop the $20 bucks!
I mean it's a good game and all though i would like the sandwiches and the bear to respawn atleast when you restart the game. but other then that it's a lovely game :D
The game is ok but it keeps resetting
The game is quite relaxing and enjoyable. Like others, I feel like the controls could be a bit tighter, particularly with reeling. But other than that everything is great.
